![lead picture](https://weeklyosm.eu/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/661_T_all.png =997x537)

GraphHopper's new Routing Engine 7.0 [[^1^](#wn661_28306)] | © GraphHopper © Mapilion © OpenMapTiles  | map data © [OpenStreetMap contributors](https://wiki.osmfoundation.org/wiki/Licence/Licence_and_Legal_FAQ)

Andres Gomez Casanova [reviewed](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/AngocA/diary/401275) :ES-s:>>>[:EN-t:](https://www-openstreetmap-org.translate.goog/user/AngocA/diary/401275?_x_tr_sl=auto&_x_tr_tl=EN) the different services and websites that are available to capture and store geo-referenced street-level photos in the world. Some of them, such as [Mapillary](https://www.mapillary.com/), [KartaView](https://kartaview.org/) and [Mapilio](https://mapilio.com/), allow the use of the images for OSM mapping.
Mapilio street-level images are now [integrated](https://github.com/openstreetmap/iD/blob/release/CHANGELOG.md#camera-street-level) into the OpenStreetMap iD Editor.
Bayram Sarıipek [announced](https://lemmy.ml/post/10085409) the addition of a dark mode for the [Mapilio](https://mapilio.com/app) app, a platform for sharing street-level imagery.

Mapilio has [announced](https://mapilio.com/openstreetmap) the integration of its image layers into OpenStreetMap via the iD editor. The partnership [aims](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/Mapilio/diary/403784) to provide mappers with improved tools for precision mapping.

Mapilio has [integrated](https://mapilio.com/blog/mapilios-newest-game-changer-openstreetmap-login-integration-55-en) OpenStreetMap login functionality, a significant step towards improving accessibility and map quality. This development allows users to seamlessly connect their OpenStreetMap accounts, making it easier to contribute and use Mapilio's tools for a better mapping experience.

Mapilio has [introduced](https://mapilio.com/blog/an-open-source-solution-for-synchronizing-kartaview-images-to-mapilio-63-en) an open-source solution for synchronising [KartaView](https://kartaview.org/) images to its platform, streamlining the process of contributing georeferenced images, enhancing map quality, and promoting community collaboration.
